org.jcvi.jillion.assembly.consed.ace

Class AceFileUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.assembly.consed.ace.AceFileUtil

  • public final class AceFileUtil
extends Object
    AceFileUtil is a utility class to perform common operations on ace related objects.

    dkatzel

    • Field Detail

      • ACE_DEFAULT_HIGH_QUALITY_THRESHOLD

        public static final PhredQuality ACE_DEFAULT_HIGH_QUALITY_THRESHOLD
        This is the default value in consed that is used to distinguish between high and low quality basecalls. In consed high quality bases are represented by uppercase letters and low quality by lowercase letters. Currently that value is set to 26.

    • Method Detail

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Throws:

      • convertToAcePaddedBasecalls

        public static String convertToAcePaddedBasecalls(NucleotideSequence basecalls)
        Convert a NucleotideSequence into a string where the gaps are represented by '*'s like ace files require.
        Parameters:
        basecalls - input basecalls, can not be null.
        Returns:
        a String with the all uppercase basecalls except all the '-' have been replaced by '*'.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if basecalls are null.

      • convertToAcePaddedBasecalls

        public static String convertToAcePaddedBasecalls(NucleotideSequence basecalls,
                                                 QualitySequence optionalQualities)
        Convert a NucleotideSequence into a string where the gaps are represented by '*'s like ace files require. If the optional qualities list is provided, then the returned String will return a basecalls in both upper and lowercase depending on the quality value as determined by ACE_DEFAULT_HIGH_QUALITY_THRESHOLD.
        Parameters:
        basecalls - input basecalls, can not be null or contain any null elements.
        optionalQualities - optional ungapped quality list in the same orientation as the basecalls; or null if no qualities are to be used.
        Returns:
        a String with the all uppercase basecalls except all the '-' have been replaced by '*'.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if basecalls are null or any Nucleotide in the basecall list is null or if the optionalQualities list is not null but contains a null in the list.
        IllegalArgumentException - if optionalQualities is provided but does not have enough ungapped qualities to cover all the ungapped basecalls in the input list.

      • computeConsensusQualities

        public static QualitySequence computeConsensusQualities(Contig<? extends AssembledRead> contig,
                                                        QualitySequenceDataStore readQualities)
                                                 throws DataStoreException
        Compute the consensus quality sequence as computed by the same algorithm consed uses.
        Parameters:
        contig - the contig to compute the consensus qualities for; can not be null. ConsensusQualities will only represent the qualities for the UNGAPPED consensus sequence.
        readQualities - a QualitySequenceDataStore containing QualitySequences for the underlying reads; can not be null.
        Returns:
        a QualitySequence can not be null.
        Throws:
        DataStoreException - if there is a problem fetching quality data from the QualitySequenceDataStore.
        NullPointerException - if either parameter is null.
